description.en: The Personal Identification Number (PIN) is a number which identifies a person or legal entity for purposes of transacting business with Kenya Revenue Authority, other Government agencies and service providers in Kenya. A PIN may be issued to both individuals and 'artificial persons' such as companies, clubs, trusts and partnerships.

access.onlineAccessDetails: The Kenya Revenue Authority provide a PIN Checker service at https://itax.kra.go.ke/KRA-Portal/pinChecker.htm?actionCode=loadPage&viewType=static which can be used to verify a PIN and lookup the address and tax registration details of an organisation.
access.guidanceOnLocatingIds: Consult with an organisation to ask for their PIN. This will be available on a PIN Certificate.
